subject: New review (4★) of Simsonn VAM Pro Linear Motor - the Pedals Haptic Reactor for Vibration Feedback (from Wayne S.)
description_text:
Rating: 4 | Review Text: I thought it would be worth an update - the hardware is very nice and to date, very reliable, they do look like a quality piece of kit, the 4 stars is for the hardware alone, the kit does not come with a USB cable, so remember to grab one if you don't already have one.
The packaging is good so they travel safe.
Make sure you are going to use Simhub with these as the software from Simsonn just doesn't shine at all, it's possibly great for pedal adjustment but I cannot comment as I have VRS Pedals but the haptics for my chosen sim, iRacing are basically non functional, you'll get 1 or 2 functions firing to a degree but it's a work in progress I think, either way Simhub is the way to go right now. Unfortunately I've not got a nice setup yet but still playing with it to get it running nicely, a present it's just muddling info coming through the pedal, delays and lagging after the effect should stop, I'll work it out. Overall I'd say they are worth getting but be prepared to tinker about, a lot! Simsonn are nice people to deal with and do their best to help via support, they are nice to deal with. conversations.body_text: Hi Wayne Shephard ,     We have received your feedback. Are you currently using SIMSONN Manager version 2.0.9? Also, does the software prompt any firmware updates? Please ensure you are using the latest version.  Regarding iRacing telemetry support — the game itself does not provide native ABS and TC telemetry data. SIMHUB calculates these values based on other parameters. In contrast, games like ACC offer direct telemetry data for ABS and TC.  As for the vibration stop function, this issue should have been resolved in the latest version. We've adopted a mechanism similar to SIMHUB, where a stop command is sent at regular intervals after 5 seconds of inactivity to prevent unexpected vibration due to USB instability or missed stop signals.  I will also send you a list of telemetry-supported games in version 2.0.9 for your reference.

Hi folks, you're so quick to respond! Wow.
I just loaded up the Manager software and looked in settings, and yes, it's offered a firmware update, just doing it now, will let you know if that gives some good results.

King regards,
Wayne

Sent from Outlook for Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________

Hi folks,
            I just updated the firmware and running on 2.09 software in
iRacing, the VAM Pro's have some motion, gearshift, clutch and speed give
some sort of vibration, none of which I will be needing.
The wheel slip and lock functions do nothing, that may be expected due to
iRacing outputs?
I have purchased these to emulate loss of grip in some format, so I think
Simhub is the only way that will be effective.
Great to have updated the firmware though.
I'm guessing your software may be of use in other sims more so than in
iRacing.
I'll keep trying with Simhub to get what I'm after, I understand these are
new items of hardware, so there will be some teething and testing to get
them right.
Hopefully in a week or so I get them dialled in.

Thanks for responding so quickly, I hope you see my review as purely
constructive :)

Kind regards,
Wayne
